messages.message: Does anyone have this issue with Jenkins where if you click on the link from github PR or go to jenkins.instabase.com (http://jenkins.instabase.com) it’ll just sign you out. But if you go from okta, you can login and look around?
@zach and I are looking into ways to fix logout integration with SAML.
yeah you have to logout of okta and back in. At least that made it wokr for me

That's correct the first time. We have Single Log Out (SLO) turned on now. This is an issue with the SAML Plugin for Jenkins. With SLO if you close the browser, the sessions times out, or you logout manually it should auto direct you to okta auth to re-authenticate for Jenkins
@Eric Han and @Travis if you navigate to: http://jenkins.instabase.com/ what happens

for me I see

```You are now logged out of Jenkins, however this has not logged you out of SAML.

Have a nice day```
but i haven’t been logged in before today
@Travis if you logout and then click login what happens now
@Felicia click login and see if that redirects you back to okta to re-authenticate
If i click that i see “signing in to jenkins” with okta and then the same screen again that im logged out
I tried also after i put in the cert + enabled SLO. Still didn’t seem to work.
Just made a slight change. Try it now. If you click logout it should kill the session and redirect you back to your okta user homepage
hm. if i click jenkins in okta it will just redirect me to the okta homepage. if i click jenkins.instabase.com (http://jenkins.instabase.com) it’ll redirect me to the okta homepage too
@Felicia log out of okta completely and close your browser then try again.
